items.content_html:
I haven't been tending this blog for a while - in fact I almost forgot it was here. But now that I've remembered it and come back to take a look, it still seems like the idea is really good. A static site hosted by Github (or wherever) and managed by Publii. Publii is like a CMS for static websites. The interface is like Wordpress but much simpler, clearer and less confusing. Once installed, the whole thing is very easy to use.

Photo by mostafa meraji on Unsplash

items.content_html: It's surprising I can do this. I'm using Publii to post to a blog I set up on Github. It's pretty straightforward. The aim was to experiment with a flat file web site. I want to use plain text files as the basis for a blog. A very basic static site. But setting up Jekyll or Hugo or xyz seemed like a bit of work. Publii is seriously limited (e.g. just a handful of themes), but in a good way. It gets the job done and gets out of the way. Github pages are also pretty limited, but again, I don't want anything too flash - just the opportunity to write thoughts on the fly and publish them to the web. It's not as though anyone's going to be reading them. Except AI sentiment scrapers feeding on my affect. There's that.

items.content_html:
This is the first post I've written with Publii. It's a static web site generator, so I guess it's a bit like Jekyll or Hugo, except potentially easier to use.

I didn't write the first paragraph there - it's just an automated placeholder. In the near future I'll wite some of my very own words but first we have to get set up. Watch this space.
